TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ProtectedKey extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the contents of a wst:Entropy or a wst:RequestedProofToken element inside the RequestSecurityToken and RequestSecurityTokenResponse.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Represents the contents of a wst:Entropy or a wst:RequestedProofToken element inside the wst:RequestSecurityToken (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken>) and wst:RequestSecurityTokenResponse (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse>) messages.
For more information about the element that this class represents, see the version of the WS-Trust specification that applies to your scenario.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] secret) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains the key material to be protected.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with no encryption.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to send the key material in clear text. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.ProtectedKey.WrappingCredentials%2A> property is set to `null` in the new <xref:System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.ProtectedKey> instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] secret, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptingCredentials wrappingCredentials) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains the key material to be protected.
An that contains the credentials used to encrypt the key material.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified encrypting credentials.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to send the key material encrypted.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] GetKeyBytes() cil managed

Docs.returns: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains the key material.
Docs.value: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains the key material.

Docs.summary: Gets the encrypting credentials for the key.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.IdentityModel.SecurityTokenService.EncryptingCredentials> that represents the credentials used to encrypt the key. indicates that the key is not encrypted.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.IdentityModel.SecurityTokenService.EncryptingCredentials> that represents the credentials used to encrypt the key. indicates that the key is not encrypted.
